        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Same as <span class="line"><!---->Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>. The details are as I said in <span class="line"><!---->. The details are as I said in <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143#c70<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143#c70" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143#c70<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Here I take the DesktopCapture module mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Here I take the DesktopCapture module mentioned in <!----></span>crbug.com/1181228<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1181228" title="Security: UAF in DesktopCapture"><!---->crbug.com/1181228<!----></a> as an example:<span class="line"><!----> as an example:<!----></span><br><br>$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --enable-usermedia-screen-capturing "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --enable-usermedia-screen-capturing "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug-info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug-info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The MessageBoxDialog lifetime looks pretty wonky to me unless it ends up in creating a Widget and showing it asynchronously. All calls that end up synchronous seem like a liability to me, ShowSync is especially suspect.<span class="line"><!---->The MessageBoxDialog lifetime looks pretty wonky to me unless it ends up in creating a Widget and showing it asynchronously. All calls that end up synchronous seem like a liability to me, ShowSync is especially suspect.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><br><br>This whole thing looks super sketchy when not using a |callback|. I'd see if you can find calls to this that don't supply a callback and if they do, try to make those calls not end up synchronous.<span class="line"><!---->This whole thing looks super sketchy when not using a |callback|. I'd see if you can find calls to this that don't supply a callback and if they do, try to make those calls not end up synchronous.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi, it seems that the reward-topanel tag has not been handled for three months. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, it seems that the reward-topanel tag has not been handled for three months. <!----></span><br><br>I noticed that the rules for handling stack overflows have been modified[1], but the modification was made one month later after the reward-topanel tag of this issue.<span class="line"><!---->I noticed that the rules for handling stack overflows have been modified[1], but the modification was made one month later after the reward-topanel tag of this issue.<!----></span><br><br>Will it apply to this issue, or will this issue get a reward as [2] and [3]?<span class="line"><!---->Will it apply to this issue, or will this issue get a reward as [2] and [3]?<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3154969<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3154969"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3154969<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202661<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202661"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202661<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        thanks pbos@ for brining this to my attention and apologies leecraso@ for not updating much earlier. I owed an update on this one and had marked it as updated in the logs, but did not actually update it here with the explanation.<span class="line"><!---->thanks pbos@ for brining this to my attention and apologies leecraso@ for not updating much earlier. I owed an update on this one and had marked it as updated in the logs, but did not actually update it here with the explanation.<!----></span><br> By the time we reviewed this, that rule was already being applied by the VRP panel in award decisions for some time. This bug was already independently reviewed back on 23 August (again, my sincere apologies that I did not update sooner) and it was determined that we could not extend a reward for this issue was it appears to only touch the stack and does not appear to be exploitable to result in a security/memory unsafety issue. <span class="line"><!----> By the time we reviewed this, that rule was already being applied by the VRP panel in award decisions for some time. This bug was already independently reviewed back on 23 August (again, my sincere apologies that I did not update sooner) and it was determined that we could not extend a reward for this issue was it appears to only touch the stack and does not appear to be exploitable to result in a security/memory unsafety issue. <!----></span><br><br>As always, if you can demonstrate exploitability of a security issue here, we would be happy to revisit and reassess for a potential reward.<span class="line"><!---->As always, if you can demonstrate exploitability of a security issue here, we would be happy to revisit and reassess for a potential reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;

          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          overflow: hidden;

      </style>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }

        for LitElement.

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>
        
        <table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody></table>

            padding: 0;

          }

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;

          }

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Same as <span class="line"><!---->Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>. The details are as I said in <span class="line"><!---->. The details are as I said in <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143#c70<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143#c70" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143#c70<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Here I take the DesktopCapture module mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Here I take the DesktopCapture module mentioned in <!----></span>crbug.com/1181228<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1181228" title="Security: UAF in DesktopCapture"><!---->crbug.com/1181228<!----></a> as an example:<span class="line"><!----> as an example:<!----></span><br><br>$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --enable-usermedia-screen-capturing "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --enable-usermedia-screen-capturing "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug-info file<span         The MessageBoxDialog lifetime looks pretty wonky to me unless it ends up in creating a Widget and showing it asynchronously. All calls that end up synchronous seem like a liability to me, ShowSync is especially suspect.<span class="line"><!---->The MessageBoxDialog lifetime looks pretty wonky to me unless it ends up in creating a Widget and showing it asynchronously. All calls that end up synchronous seem like a liability to me, ShowSync is especially suspect.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><br><br>This whole thing looks super sketchy when not using a |callback|. I'd see if you can find calls to this that don't supply a callback and if they do, try to make those calls not end up synchronous.<span class="line"><!---->This whole thing looks super sketchy when not using a |callback|. I'd see if you can find calls to this that don't supply a callback and if they do, try to make those calls not end up synchronous.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        I'd be wary of this specifically:<span class="line"><!---->I'd be wary of this specifically:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/media/webrtc/desktop_capture_access_handler.cc;l=233?q=screen%20capture%20chrome::Show%20-f:%5Eout&ss=chromium<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/media/webrtc/desktop_capture_access_handler.cc;l=233?q=screen%20capture%20chrome::Show%20-f:%5Eout&amp;ss=chromium"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/media/webrtc/desktop_capture_access_handler.cc;l=233?q=screen%20capture%20chrome::Show%20-f:%5Eout&amp;ss=chromium<!----></a><br><br>This may imply that DesktopCaptureAccessHandler::ProcessScreenCaptureAccessRequest needs to be async. I haven't dug deeper.<span class="line"><!---->This may imply that DesktopCaptureAccessHandler::ProcessScreenCaptureAccessRequest needs to be async. I haven't dug deeper.<!----></span><br><br>Long-term I wish we can get rid of all sync chrome::Show...<span class="line"><!---->Long-term I wish we can get rid of all sync chrome::Show...<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        thanks pbos@ for brining this to my attention and apologies leecraso@ for not updating much earlier. I owed an update on this one and had marked it as updated in the logs, but did not actually update it here with the explanation.<span class="line"><!---->thanks pbos@ for brining this to my attention and apologies leecraso@ for not updating much earlier. I owed an update on this one and had marked it as updated in the logs, but did not actually update it here with the explanation.<!----></span><br> By the time we reviewed this, that rule was already being applied by the VRP panel in award decisions for some time. This bug was already independently reviewed back on 23 August (again, my sincere apologies that I did not update sooner) and it was determined that we could not extend a reward for this issue was it appears to only touch the stack and does not appear to be exploitable to result in a security/memory unsafety issue. <span class="line"><!----> By the time we reviewed this, that rule was already being applied by the VRP panel in award decisions for some time. This bug was already independently reviewed back on 23 August (again, my sincere apologies that I did not update sooner) and it was determined that we could not extend a reward for this issue was it appears to only touch the stack and does not appear to be exploitable to result in a security/memory unsafety issue. <!----></span><br><br>As always, if you can demonstrate exploitability of a security issue here, we would be happy to revisit and reassess for a potential reward.<span class="line"><!---->As always, if you can demonstrate exploitability of a security issue here, we would be happy to revisit and reassess for a potential reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Save changes
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }

        }

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Same as <span class="line"><!---->Same as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <span class="line"><!---->, there are many other modules that could create nested message loops[1]. If we call those functions frequently to create nested message loops recursively, the stack will be pushed constantly, and eventually leading to the stack overflow as <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143<!----></a>. The details are as I said in <span class="line"><!---->. The details are as I said in <!----></span>crbug.com/1138143#c70<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143#c70" title="segmentation fault in mojom::clipboard"><!---->crbug.com/1138143#c70<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:base/run_loop.cc;l=111;bpv=1;bpt=0;drc=e125e8d6661068afe340b0fd2c09d49f74ffe48b<!----></a><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Here I take the DesktopCapture module mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Here I take the DesktopCapture module mentioned in <!----></span>crbug.com/1181228<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1181228" title="Security: UAF in DesktopCapture"><!---->crbug.com/1181228<!----></a> as an example:<span class="line"><!----> as an example:<!----></span><br><br>$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --enable-usermedia-screen-capturing "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx --enable-blink-features=MojoJS --enable-usermedia-screen-capturing "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<span class="line"><!---->Wait for around 30s, you will get a segmentation fault.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see attached debug-info file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see attached debug-info file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The MessageBoxDialog lifetime looks pretty wonky to me unless it ends up in creating a Widget and showing it asynchronously. All calls that end up synchronous seem like a liability to me, ShowSync is especially suspect.<span class="line"><!---->The MessageBoxDialog lifetime looks pretty wonky to me unless it ends up in creating a Widget and showing it asynchronously. All calls that end up synchronous seem like a liability to me, ShowSync is especially suspect.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/message_box_dialog.cc;l=75;drc=5a6e8bc98efd6d4f8203c664ffb6f469918c0a54;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><br><br>This whole thing looks super sketchy when not using a |callback|. I'd see if you can find calls to this that don't supply a callback and if they do, try to make those calls not end up synchronous.<span class="line"><!---->This whole thing looks super sketchy when not using a |callback|. I'd see if you can find calls to this that don't supply a callback and if they do, try to make those calls not end up synchronous.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Hi, it seems that the reward-topanel tag has not been handled for three months. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, it seems that the reward-topanel tag has not been handled for three months. <!----></span><br><br>I noticed that the rules for handling stack overflows have been modified[1], but the modification was made one month later after the reward-topanel tag of this issue.<span class="line"><!---->I noticed that the rules for handling stack overflows have been modified[1], but the modification was made one month later after the reward-topanel tag of this issue.<!----></span><br><br>Will it apply to this issue, or will this issue get a reward as [2] and [3]?<span class="line"><!---->Will it apply to this issue, or will this issue get a reward as [2] and [3]?<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3154969<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3154969"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3154969<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1138143<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202661<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202661"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1202661<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        thanks pbos@ for brining this to my attention and apologies leecraso@ for not updating much earlier. I owed an update on this one and had marked it as updated in the logs, but did not actually update it here with the explanation.<span class="line"><!---->thanks pbos@ for brining this to my attention and apologies leecraso@ for not updating much earlier. I owed an update on this one and had marked it as updated in the logs, but did not actually update it here with the explanation.<!----></span><br> By the time we reviewed this, that rule was already being applied by the VRP panel in award decisions for some time. This bug was already independently reviewed back on 23 August (again, my sincere apologies that I did not update sooner) and it was determined that we could not extend a reward for this issue was it appears to only touch the stack and does not appear to be exploitable to result in a security/memory unsafety issue. <span class="line"><!----> By the time we reviewed this, that rule was already being applied by the VRP panel in award decisions for some time. This bug was already independently reviewed back on 23 August (again, my sincere apologies that I did not update sooner) and it was determined that we could not extend a reward for this issue was it appears to only touch the stack and does not appear to be exploitable to result in a security/memory unsafety issue. <!----></span><br><br>As always, if you can demonstrate exploitability of a security issue here, we would be happy to revisit and reassess for a potential reward.<span class="line"><!---->As always, if you can demonstrate exploitability of a security issue here, we would be happy to revisit and reassess for a potential reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          min-width: 256px;

          width: 100%;
